name: Alspach's conjecture
summary: A mathematical theorem known as Alspach's conjecture describes the disjoint cycle covers of complete graphs with certain cycle lengths. It bears Brian Alspach's name, who first proposed it as a research question in 1981. Darryn Bryant, Daniel Horsley, and William Pettersson (2014) published a proof.
references: Aigner, Martin; Ziegler, Günter M. (2018), Proofs from THE BOOK (6th ed.), Springer, pp. 79–80, doi:10.1007/978-3-662-57265-8, ISBN 978-3-662-57265-8
Graham, R. L.; Pollak, H. O. (1971), "On the addressing problem for loop switching", The Bell System Technical Journal, 50 (8): 2495–2519, doi:10.1002/j.1538-7305.1971.tb02618.x, MR 0289210

Graham, R. L.; Pollak, H. O. (1972), "On embedding graphs in squashed cubes", Graph theory and applications (Proc. Conf., Western Michigan Univ., Kalamazoo, Mich., 1972; dedicated to the memory of J. W. T. Youngs), Lecture Notes in Mathematics, vol. 303, pp. 99–110, MR 0332576],
